intro: Argyreia seguinii, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from white to deep purple. The plant produces showy, spiral-shaped seed pods that contain numerous small, angular seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
